as a game data analyst at worldwide webb you will be responsible for creating actionable insights from the data we collect that ultimately leads to a world-class gaming experience. with a deep understanding of our players behaviors you will build dashboards and reports that deliver tangible insights that you will present across multiple levels within the organization ultimately helping shape the players experience within worldwide webb.

responsibilities
 creating and maintaining analytics queries and dashboards including main kpis perform deep dives into specific game features to understand their impact on the behavior of our players working with the design management teams to define and analyse game metrics to support wider business decisions present and explain patterns in data to a wide audience identifying areas for improvements in existing and future games confidence in data handling statistical and visualization tools strong communication skills both in a technical and non-technical context self-motivation and excellent organisational/documentation skills passion for both data and games good problem-solving skills – able to think critically and holistically about data ability to provide actionable insights based on the results of data analysis

desired
 experience in the games industry

requirments
a bachelor’s degree in mathematics statistics computer science economics or a related quantitative field; or a graduate degree in data science or business analytics.experience with bigqueryexperience with scripting languages python the ability to tell a convincing story with data.strong written and oral communication skills. `indie game experience is a huge bonus!

at a glance

us: fast growing startup of 80+ people. remote team mainly based in the uk. yc alumni summer 2019. were on a mission to connect people around the world to make trustworthy data more accessible and facilitate world-changing research 🚀

the role

as a complex marketplace platform with a strong focus on data we know we are sitting on a trove of information that can take our product and world-class research to the next level. we are looking for a mid-level data analyst who will help us utilise our data to give us the important insights we need to make crucial business decisions.

the ideal candidate will be comfortable working with large data sets and able to use statistics and know how to identify and interpret important patterns in our data. you should have strong experience with sql and be comfortable with python. you will have knowledge of product-driven event and data analytics and familiarity with using bi tools to communicate your findings.

you will work as part of our small but excellent team of data analysts scientists and engineers. were a deeply collaborative and friendly team who work together to support prolifics mission through insights and data products.

what youll be doing
analysing how user behaviour drives platform growth and making recommendations on how to allocate resources to improve this growth.improving the quality the honesty and engagement of prolifics participant pool through analysis of user behaviour and collection of new data.increasing the diversity and representativeness of prolifics participant pool by ongoing monitoring and analysis of demographics.helping our marketing team understand the impact of their campaigns and predict roi.improving the way the data team works and helping shape business decisions.unpicking the relationships between key growth metrics retention stickiness churn and determining causal links between product changes and growth. using bi platforms such as metabase to create visualisations segment our user base and develop dashboards.telling stories with data and writing reports that summarise the insights youve gained and your confidence in your findings.

what youll bring
experience writing high-quality analytic sql and some experience with python.understanding of statistical practices and common analytical techniques.experience of product analytics such as a/b tests retention and churn metrics.great verbal and written communication skills as evidenced by presentations and written reports.a hunger to learn lots of new things!

even better if you have
experience building production dashboards in a common bi platform looker tableau powerbi etc.comfortable using git for version controlknowledge of advanced techniques such as machine learning or multilevel modelling.understanding of marketplace dynamics behavioural research or or business intelligence.

what youll get

⚖️ work life balance: were all looking to strike the right work-life balance and as a remote-first company youre able to work flexibly from home or our dog-friendly co-working space in old street. we offer 25 days of holiday plus bank holidays of course which you can opt out of if youd like. we also offer summer hours with early finish fridays throughout june to august.

🏡 family life: we offer generous maternity paternity and shared parental leave. need to pick your child up from school? no problem. our flexible working gives you the childcare flexibility you need.

🧘 wellbeing: we care deeply about our employees well-being and thats why we offer comprehensive bupa private health insurance that disregards medical history and also medicash a health cash plan. we also offer a taxable monthly stipend of £150 that you can spend on whatever improves your wellness and remote working experience. having a healthy working environment is really important to us and so we offer a £1000 home office budget along with a mac laptop when you start - plus a £200 yearly top-up.

📚 learn & grow: development is really important to us and we want to give all of our employees the opportunity to learn and grow. there are many personal growth and career progression opportunities available as well as mentoring. and we also offer a £1000 yearly budget for education growth and training for you to use at your discretion.

💙 culture: were a friendly bunch here at prolific; open transparent and inclusive. although were a remote-first company we still love to hang out with each other! we run collaborative quarterly company-wide meets up and team socials both virtually and in-person and its all paid for by us. alongside this we offer a £1000 yearly team meet-up budget for discretionary meet-ups so that you can cover travel food and accommodation. as a business were also committed to carbon offsetting; each month we donate money in your name to plant trees and being remote were doing our bit to offset travel as well.

our interview process

talent call: youll meet with one of our talent team and have an exploratory call about the role requirements life at prolific as well as your background and aspirations.

hiring manager interview: youll interview with two members of the team one of which will be the hiring manager. youll have the opportunity to ask about the company and the role and well ask you questions about your experiences and goals.

panel interview: well hold a panel interview that evaluates skills required for the role. youll meet with more of our team and may be asked to complete a presentation or task. youll be compensated with a £50 voucher 💰 for completing the task because we know your time is valuable!

final interview: we will deep dive into your past experiences goals motivations and skills all aligned to our prolific principles. youll speak with two to three members of the team and - as always - have an opportunity to ask questions about the role and company.

diversity equity and inclusion monitoring

prolific is an equal opportunity employer. we celebrate diversity and are committed to fostering diversity equity and inclusion in the workplace. we welcome all applications and consider them without regard to race religion belief age gender gender expression gender identity gender reassignment disability marriage or civil partnership status pregnancy or maternity sex or sexual orientation.

we are committed to ensuring a fair recruitment process its essential to our success. under the equality act 2010 we collect information from individuals at the point of application. we anonymously monitor the profiles of individuals that apply to each vacancy to ensure that no individual is unfairly discriminated against or disadvantaged.

📌 we are soax an emerging company specializing in automated data collection services for companies worldwide. on the demand side our priority is to deliver the best-in-class experience for data-hungry businesses across the globe while collecting public data on the web. performance security and customer-centric approach are our core values in this direction.

we are looking for an independent data analyst who ideally has experience in data engineering and/or data science.

you will create and upgrade models for the proxy routing logic do research and find new ways to give our clients data faster build the process of automatic metrics calculation from raw data collect data and refine the storage structure.

we are looking for open-minded and responsible teammates with 2+ years of experience who ideally has experience in data engineering and/or data science. we appreciate specialists who can think in their own way create seamless processes from a mess and take responsibility for their useful daily activities.

main tasks
run the statistical analysis to determine patterns in traffic distribution to suggest improvements to our productresearch proxy connection logs to come up with new hypotheses on how to improve performance for our clients present your results to the teamsuggest data points to collect in order to build more precise models of traffic distributionwork closely with product teams to help answer their questions and find new ideas for researchimprove our current data collection process and data storage architecture: create new aggregation tables improve etl processes improve event logging etc.
minimum qualifications
sql & python are a must.independence ability to decompose large tasks and understanding of business requirements.proficiency in statistics.a logical and structured approach to problem-solving and clear communication.
will be a plus
interest in product analytics or another product background is a plus.experience in working with the entire data infrastructure in small startups is a plus.
what we can offer
you can work from anywhere you want including flexible hours! furthermore we don’t promote work-life balance in the traditional sense. instead we believe in work-life integration and care about results above all elseare you ready to wow the world? soax provides global opportunities to bring your creativity to fresh new challenges every day. were a fast-growing startup and we have big goals! you will be able to help us achieve the next milestone in our journeyat soax you will thrive if you want to grow learn and stretch yourself. that’s why we provide learning and development budgets for courses and bookswe know money talks so we offer a competitive salary and benefits in gbpgreat team of enthusiasts to work with we have a culture that emphasizes collaboration energy and openness so that newcomers will feel at home with us quickly. our onboarding process is fast-paced but still supportive :

nix & kix is one of the fastest-growing soft drinks brands in the uk. we produce a range of adult soft drinks that are infused with a hint of uk grown chilli for a natural pick-me-up.

we are a small london based company on a big mission to remove the boredom and stigma that surrounds soft drinks. we run a slick operation here at nix & kix hq and we’re looking for ambitious hungry and enthusiastic junior data analysts to join our team!

position overview:

nix&kix are a soft drinks start-up with something a little different. founded by julia and kerstin 5 years ago they saw an opportunity to spice up the sector quite literally!

all nix&kix drinks are entirely natural low sugar vegan and come with a unique cayenne addition providing that extra kick.

as a member of bitrise’s data team you will be embedded into our build infrastructure product team helping them to make product decisions enable new integrations or roll out new features. you can have a real impact here your work will serve as a compass for developers and product owners. join us and help them make the most of their efforts.

as a product data analyst at bitrise you will
own the end-to-end data pipeline of the bitrise build infrastructure one of the largest macos infra on the whole market. your work fundamentally defines the speed and quality of product development decisions of the core mobile ci/cd product. work on complex data problems to ensure the health of the bitrise build infrastructure.contribute to the creation of new algorithms for the most optimal orchestration of this large infrastructure.identify new opportunities to create end-user impact in terms of ci/cd speed optimisations by focusing on big data analysis. set and evaluate tests on product features apply analytical techniques to understand and improve bitrise’s business and user experiencecollaborate closely with product owners and other stakeholders in cross-functional teams set key indicators of initiatives to track their improvementsbuild business intelligence reports and dashboards apply data visualization techniques and present your findings and insights to the stakeholderswork closely with data engineers to construct data setsrecommend your own ideas based on analysis and modeling of user behavior product metrics and industry trends

key skills and characteristics
you have worked for a software company as a customer or product analystyou’ve been part of agile teamsyou have constructed and evaluated a/b testsyou have worked with relational databases and you are familiar with warehousing technologies like snowflake or google bigqueryyou are a master of sqlyou are familiar with one or more languages used in the data domain like r python java or scalayou can turn numbers into stories you can tell that story argue and persuade stakeholders

what would really knock our socks off
been part of a rapidly growing company/teamused data science techniques such as predictive modeling or machine learningcreated product features from data produced by customersworked with event tracking tools such as segment or freshpaintexploring user behavior using product analytics tools such as amplitudeexperience with pub/subyou have built fancy dashboards in tools like tableau powerbi qlik or any similar tool.you have a good understanding of advanced statistics

what we offer
accelerated learning and a commitment to invest in your personal growth and development in the form of courses conferences book allowance and morea massive amount of freedom and trust while your contributions help shape and grow bitrise for years to comethe opportunity to play a role in the mobile development process for the world’s most successful companiesthe security of working in a financially stable growing company with an ever-expanding global customer basethe opportunity to travel the world to meet learn from and connect to end-users at conferences and meetings as well as the chance to occasionally work from one of our international offices

about bitrise

bitrise is a mobile devops platform and a mobile ci/cd service. it’s where tens of thousands of mobile teams build test and deploy their apps including companies such as transferwise now “wise” virgin mobile grindr tonal compass mozilla philips hue babbel and others. with customers ranging from startups and mobile unicorns to centuries-old enterprises applications built tested and deployed through bitrise have made their way to billions of end users around the world. chances are you have at least some of those apps on your phone right now. we’re proud y-combinator alumni.

are you interested in joining a revolutionary fast-paced and innovative environment?

about us

for decades the clearing of financial transactions remained unchanged and unchallenged. we asked ‘what if there was a better way? what if we could make those transactions faster safer more reliable and accessible to all?’

our pioneering approach has opened the door to innovation enabling our partners to thrive. we continue to ask ‘what if...?’ every day working with our partners to bring their powerful financial services to everyone from shopkeepers and savers to businesses and institutions.

it’s the skill and enterprise of our own people that make this happen and it’s clearbank’s belief in fairness autonomy and choice that means they have opportunities to learn grow and contribute to our partners’ success. for more about clearbank check out our website here.

about the opportunity

data is vital to clearbank.  we need it for everything from stopping terrorist financing to better understanding our customers.  this is a role for someone who believes in the powers of data and how it can be used to deliver a core part of our ambitious growing organisation.

the right candidate will be joining a growing team who deliver advanced analytics and artificial intelligence with market leading technology. the team will be critical in delivering on our data strategy that promotes a data-native culture and full data transparency while providing transformative enterprise-wide insights.

we are building a data community that thrives from self-service capabilities while maintaining good quality data meaning disseminating knowledge mentoring and implementing a robust analytics framework will be key to success. this community is made up all types of people from data engineers and architects to business domain experts so soft skills are just as important as the technical ones.  

about you

you will be passionate about data a problem solver and have a methodical and logical approach to delivery. an attention to detail and ability to scrutinise will be invaluable in ensuring you deliver trusted analytics and insights be that reports / mi predictive analytics or statistical analysis. you will be experienced performing and presenting data analysis for example relating to financial crime including automated monitoring platforms and aware of the required techniques to achieve this.

we’re looking for an all-rounder who is motivated by a fast-paced environment and isn’t afraid to bring new ideas to the team. and you’ll be joining the #1 fastest growing tech company in the uk according to deloitte fast 50.

core skills and experience:

the ideal candidate will demonstrate outstanding technical capabilities and aptitude to learn. experience and passion of working in an agile innovative and fast paced environment is key to this role.  
essential experience of data analysis relating to banking / payments / financial crime / transaction monitoring / payment screening / fraud transformationdesirable experience in agency banking or correspondent banking contextexpert in sql and analytics / reporting approaches with exceptional visual representation skillsexperience applying data science techniques to analytics writing and maintaining machine learning algorithms and leveraging languages such as scala or pythonarticulate communicator who loves to champion data and its potential  proven track record of working with technical and non-technical users on how to leverage data to achieve the best outcomes knowledge of azure devops databricks spark mlflow and power bi experience of working with u.k. payment schemes ideal but not essential

what we offer:
competitive salary‘fresh air fridays’ - the flexible option to finish early on a friday where possible25 days annual leave + bank holidays2 days off per year to do something ‘bigger than clearbank’ charity dayscompetitive employee benefits and perksremote-first working with access to london and bristol officesregular in-person and online socialsa supportive challenging and agile environmentflexible working practicesyou’ll also get to work in one of the most exciting banks in the market right now!

the legal bit: by submitting your cv you confirm that you can demonstrate you have the right to work in the uk. regretfully we are not in a position to sponsor applicants for immigration purposes at the current time. by submitting your cv to clearbank limited you are providing your consent for us to use the information you provide for recruitment purposes. for more information on how we manage your data go and check out our candidate privacy notice on the clearbank® website to see how we process manage and look after your data. you are also allowing us to communicate with you by email and telephone for recruitment purposes.

about us:

yulife is creating a new kind of insurance company. our mission is to inspire people to live longer happier and healthier lives. we provide life insurance to companies and drive employee wellbeing through meaningful engaging and rewarding experiences inspired by our favourite games apps and products.

we live by a simple principle and we strive to translate this to our designs: always seek the win-win in everything we do. this means we should always be giving more than we take with every interaction. sounds good?

the journey so far:

whats happened over the last few years:

the 2022 mission is to reach 1 million lives!

the role:

we are looking for an inquisitive product data analyst to join our scaling data and liveops teams. you will be instrumental in helping product teams understand how users interact with the products we build and defining what we might do to improve engagement.

over the next 12 months you’ll be instrumental in:
helping us understand core engagement patterns in our gamified app.tracking the impact of campaigns and new features on our end-users.delivering insight that helps us refine new features across multiple products.helping us raise a stellar series c.

creating high level analysis dashboards for stakeholders to monitor the performance of specific campaigns and features. conducting granular investigations into ux data. writing out event tracking requirements to specify where and how we collect data on our platforms. fame mechanic and hr platform analysis - feature introduction performance and optimisation investigations. live-ops campaigns - keeping track of campaign performance and regularly reporting their status back to stakeholders feedback development and survey analysis: including but not limited to surveys nps ces and ux research a/b tests analysis - reviewing a/b test findings and interpreting results focus will be across multiple aspects and areas to explore a variety of tools platforms and analysis techniques with the opportunity to focus on preferred areas over time.

you’ll report to matt doltis head of data.

requirements

dashboarding / analytics tools adobe analytics / mixpanel / amplitude / tableau / qlik / powerbi / looker strong analytical and communication skills accuracy and attention to detail understanding of user/product life cycles an understanding of the variable factors that influence behavioural data a willingness to explore new concepts and question data and findings 

what you’ll get:

we like to give more than we take so here are some of our benefits:
a competitive base salarypotential to earn share options6x salary life assurance policyincome protection policyaccess to the yulife app which includes a tonne of well-being rewards discounts and exclusive offers as well as access to calm and fiitmonthly wellbeing budget to “be your best yu”contributions to working from home office equipmentcontributory pension - 3% of basic24 days of annual leave + 1 day to celebrate your birthdayflexible and remote working arrangements read more belowa shiny macbook pro or whatever you need to do your best workcycle to work schemehiit and yoga sessionsaccess to learnerbly with a dedicated budget towards l&d through webinars books podcasts journals and much moremore happi - 2 professional coaching sessions every month

our values:

at yulife we turn financial products into a force for good and help companies empower their employees to be healthier and happier in mind and body.

job_title: data insight analyst - green energy giant - london & remote -
job_description_lines:
data & reporting partner - insight analysis - green energy brand - £60k & 10% car & 20% bonus

our client believes in making britain more connected so we can all lead smarter greener lives.

theyve built the secure infrastructure thats supporting the mass roll-out of smart meters across the country their universal secure network will be in 30 million homes and small businesses making it the largest network in britain.

its a truly exciting time to join them youll be part of a team thats supporting the countrys transition to a low-carbon economy and helping to ensure an affordable secure and sustainable energy supply for the future.

the role

the data and reporting partner is accountable for defining maintaining and improving customer engagement reporting and customer insight to enable effective monitoring and logging of company-wide customer engagement activities.

what youll be doing

define objectives and requirements to feed into the development of reports and reporting dashboards which summarise and evidence customer engagement activity and outcomes.

work closely with customer engagement programme pmo and commercial colleagues to identify continual improvements and drive efficiencies for reports and reporting dashboards

define the measurement and reporting customer engagement requirements for major change programmes to ensure that whats in it for you?

become part of our team at and youll find an inclusive culture which prizes mutual respect innovation and high performance.

the business operations & analytics team at chainalysis is looking for a business intelligence bi analyst to help define and create the next generation of deep dive and performance metrics visibility tools. our ideal candidate is comfortable in a nascent and fast-paced space with a lot of ambiguity enjoys translating complex business questions into well-defined quantitative problems and is capable of building scalable analytics solutions to answer these questions. you’ll join the finance team in our centralized analytics unit and work with stakeholders across finance product marketing sales & customer success to define metrics and scale our bi capabilities. the analytical tools and dashboards you build as a bi analyst will help us understand the drivers of success metrics and make informed business decisions.
in one year you’ll know you were successful if...
you are an expert in accessing and analyzing all of chainalysis’ datasets including sales data customer data financial system data and product usage datayou’ve treated our internal data as a product and helped to scale the company’s analytics platforms trained folks to leverage bi tools and provided your colleagues with easier access to insights you’ve built tools and mechanisms to consolidate and update data regularly to make data easily accessible to all stakeholders in the companyyou’ve translated business questions into quantitative questions uncovered the inputs into our success metrics and started publishing weekly reports that leadership teams use to identify critical areas of improvementyou’ve upkept company kpi metrics and planned data analysis roadmaps to meet the operational and performance tracking requirements across teams
a background like this helps
educational background in computer science engineering math statistics economics or a quantitative discipline preferredprofessional work experience in a hands-on analytics or data science function with proven quantitative orientation manipulating large datasets for time series analysis cohorting segmentation and forecasting.experience in inventing new metrics conducting root cause analysis a/b testing and developing reporting/visualization solutions e.g. tableau quicksightproven ability to translate ambiguous business and product questions into quantitative problem statements structure complex analysis implement large scale analytical solutions and drive business and product insights.advanced skills in sql etl product analytics tools e.g. pendo data warehouse solutions e.g. redshiftknowledge and experience with data pipeline technologies data modeling star schemas snowflake aggregation tables basic data architectures compute and reporting pclusters.fluency with statistical analytics and a programming language such as r python etc.excellent organizational skills including prioritization of multiple concurrent projects while still delivering timely and accurate results.excellent oral presentation and written communication skills - you’re passionate about storytelling via data!a just do it attitude and ability to move with urgency and customer obsession.an ownership mindset - acts and makes decisions on behalf of the company not just the team. never heard of the words “not my job”.
the following would differentiate you
engineering experience or familiarity with technologies such as aws pendo airflow hadoop or sparkdeep understanding of saas kpis
at chainalysis we help government agencies cryptocurrency businesses and financial institutions track and investigate illicit activity on the blockchain allowing them to engage confidently with cryptocurrency. we take care of our people with great benefits professional development opportunities and fun.
you belong here. 
at chainalysis we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger. with both customers and employees around the world we are committed to ensuring our team reflects the unique communities around us. some of the ways we’re ensuring we keep learning are an internal diversity committee days of reflection throughout the year including international women’s day juneteenth harvey milk day and international migrant’s day and a commitment to continue revisiting and reevaluating our diversity culture.
we encourage applicants across any race ethnicity gender/gender expression age spirituality ability experience and more. additionally if you need any accommodations to make our interview process more accessible to you due to a disability dont hesitate to let us know. you can learn more here. we can’t wait to meet you.

all employees are required to have or obtain a covid-19 vaccination as a condition of employment at chainalysis unless an exemption has been approved. all employees shall be required to report their vaccine status. all new employees shall be required to provide proof of their vaccination status prior to the start of their employment.

as an employer chainalysis is obliged to ensure a healthy and safe working environment. this means that we must try to prevent the coronavirus from spreading inside the workplace and all employees are obliged to follow the local regulations issued by the relevant health authorities. to help support a safe work environment we encourage all employees in emea to get fully vaccinated against covid-19.employees will not be required to attend an event or in-person customer meeting. employees in the eu and the uk are allowed to travel internationally for internal meetings to any country deemed “green or amber” by the eu and the uk authorities. all attendees for chainalysis in-person events or meetings will be required to adhere to the following guidelines:international travel will only be permitted if you receive approval from both your manager and executive leaderyou must familiarize yourself and comply with any screening/safety protocols imposed by the entity/individual hosting the in-person meeting or eventyou must comply with any and all safety guidelines and travel restrictions established by applicable law if you are in close or proximate contact with others at the event/customer site and test positive for covid-19 you must immediately notify the people team and avoid contact with others for 10 days

job_title: junior data analyst - product lifecycle student placement
job_description_lines:
about usdomino printing sciences provides industrial printing expertise and reliable solutions to help the world’s manufacturers be sustainable and cut waste while attracting informing and protecting consumers. global manufacturers across the food and beverage life sciences personal care agrochemical and industrial sectors trust domino to support them with innovative coding marking and digital printing solutions. our products help ensure the success of manufacturers’ products by allowing them to create differentiated packaging protect against counterfeiting and ensure governmental and regulatory compliance. from best before dates on eggs to serialised identifying codes on medicines to batch codes on electronic components to competition codes in confectionery domino helps to enable product safety improved supply chain management and brand protection.
role backgroundas part of its purpose & vision domino is laying foundations around its csr strategy which includes an important drive to reduce its co2e footprint. a fundamental part of this is to analyse the environmental impact of current & future products to help shape future direction to reduce our group wide co2e footprint. we need an astute and analytical person who is able to extract data from multiple sources to produce product lifecycle assessments. this will help us build a picture of our product carbon footprint with the aim of identifying actions which can reduce/offset it towards net zero.
this role can be located remotely and we welcome applications from colleagues within any of our domino locations. candidates may need flexibility to travel on occasions as appropriate.
key responsibilitiesdeliverables: data extraction analysis and consolidation to calculate product co2 footprint and generate product lifecycle assessments 19 products in scope but this role aims to make a start with the first products.
tasks: navigate a range of data sourcesextract product data to produce product lifecycle assessments lcasidentify data gaps/inaccuracies and make suggestions on how best to close themprovide lca data to brother industries parent company where relevant understand & adapt how data fits/aligns with external reporting standards
about youthis role would suit someone wishing to gain experience in global technology organisation and who has an eye for detail. no specific experience is necessary but a general interest in science or engineering would be an advantage. we do ask for degree or equivalent an analytical mind and attention to detail. somebody with an organised approach to work who is proactive in asking for help if needed.
the role would suit a student summer placement/work experience 3-6 month contract.
what you can expectwe recognise that flexible homeworking can be beneficial and at domino we want people to feel able to own the way they work. for many of us this this might be coming into the office most days just a couple of times a week or perhaps fortnightly. what’s important is that we enable you get the best from us and for us to get the best from you whether that’s from your home office or on site as long as we continue to collaborate and enable great outcomes for our customers. 
we are a highly successful company we’re large enough to offer career development opportunities yet small enough for your contribution to be readily recognised and rewarded. our culture is built on our core values collaboration listening expertise ambition and responsibility. we think domino is a great place to work and if you join us you’ll find yourself part of organisation which really cares about their people as well as offering challenging and rewarding careers.as a dynamic company success in this role is likely to open the door to future opportunities.
positions may be at an advanced stage of the recruitment process and can close at any time.

overview
your purpose in this role is to support the data privacy manager to ensure the company’s compliance with the general data protection regulation gdpr the data protection act 2018 privacy and electronic communications regulations pecr.
in this role you will be involved with the following:
act as a supporting contact point to the data privacy manager for data subjects and the information commissioner’s office ico as well as supporting the data privacy manager advising the business and customers on data privacy matters;maintaining and updating the company’s data privacy policy internal privacy notice external privacy notice record of processing activities ropa and the data retention policy;support with ongoing review of the company’s data processing activities and compliance with data privacy requirements and in that context identify the critical matters requiring compliance focus;support with developing and documenting policies procedures and guidance to assist compliance within the business;support with the communication of ongoing compliance requirements to the relevant stakeholders at smartestenergy limited escalating any issues to the head of industry regulatory risk along with a remediation plan;support with the facilitation of implementation of “privacy by design” into systems and processes and provide expert support and guidance on such matters;support with ensuring that annual gdpr training is provided to all staff;support with maintaining and updating the company’s record of processing activities ropa as required under article 30 of the gdpr;engage with the business to ensure robust and timely completion of data privacy impact assessments dpia legitimate interest assessments lia contract reviews data protection agreement reviews and data privacy risk assessments;supporting the data privacy manager with liaison with legal counsel to ensure contracts with customers and third parties have the relevant data protection clauses where required;maintain and manage the procedure for reporting of personal data breaches escalating to the data privacy manager as appropriate;support with the procedure for data subject access requests  dsars;work closely with the company’s information security officer iso to align it security systems processes and procedures with data privacy obligations;work closely with it marketing and hr functions to ensure that best practice is operating in departments that process sensitive personal data;liaise with business and provide information with regard to data privacy compliance as required from time to time for company audits;be involved in some travel to smartestenergy’s uk offices in london and worthing.
to be successful in this role you are likely to have the following skills/experience:
ideally experience with data privacy compliance in a b2b environment; or a commitment to undertaking relevant internal and external training as a priority;ability to review and interpret legislation in order to establish the data privacy obligations which are relevant to the company’s activities;contractual review supporting the data privacy manager to ensure that third party agreements comply with data privacy requirements in relation to controller to controller and controller to processor relationships;excellent and proven stakeholder management skills capable of communicating with senior management;experienced in the application of “best practice” to data privacy procedures using a “risk based” approach;experience of carrying out data privacy audits and gap analysis;thorough knowledge and understanding of the general data protection regulation gdpr and data protection act 2018;strong understanding of the privacy in electronic communications regulations and their application;demonstrable knowledge of data privacy through attainment of the practitioner certificate in data protection pc.dp or similar qualification would be beneficial for this role.
what else do we offer?
the opportunity to work from anywhere in the world for 30 days per year;a genuine commitment to smarter working – we recognise your work/life balance matters;paid time off to volunteer in your community;excellent benefits package including private medical insurance/dental cover and non-contributory pension from month three;

having spent our first 30 years focused on travel saga launched saga magazine and developed home and motor insurance and financial services in the 1980s. private medical and pet insurance followed in the 1990s along with the launch of our own cruise ship operation. the strength of the saga brand provides the group with the ability to develop in-house or partner with suppliers to offer our customers and members highly differentiated competitively priced products which meet their evolving needs.

job_title: agile systems analyst x4 - 100% home based £75k

job_description_lines:
agile systems analyst x5 100% home based £75k + benefits

global ftse100 client is seeking a number of system analyst / business analysts with experience of azure / aws / devops / agile / confluence / apis. you will operate as an experienced technical business analyst / agile systems analyst.

this is a great opportunity for a technical business analyst to join a leading service provider working on a digital transformation program that will deliver a new cloud management platform to manage our clients hybrid cloud environments.

working in an agile environment you will be part of the devops team and will be responsible for understanding business processes and requirements as well as existing system behaviours to produce high quality user stories that can be estimated built and tested.

facing off to product managers delivery leads business and technical smes and senior stakeholders you will play a key role in ensuring that the system meets its requirements delivers business value and can be delivered efficiently.

responsibilities as the technical business analyst

conducting detailed analysis on business processes and requirements and producing high quality documentation which is clear concise and accessible to business and technical audiences

writing high quality testable user stories to ensure that these can be estimated delivered by developers and used to define test automation and which.

analysing understanding and documenting existing system behaviour including data mapping to support integration design as well as identification of system features and data requirements.

data/business analysis required to identify volumetric requirements for specific use cases to feed into capacity models and performance testing as well as gathering and refining operational requirements.

understanding and identifying business value and continually communicating and advocating that view to ensure that the delivery is focused on business needs and delivers that value.

skills and experience as the technical business analyst or system analyst:

experience as a technical business analyst working directly with software engineers in an agile environment and ideally as part of a devops model.

experience in producing high quality user stories for hybrid cloud environments to a predefined readiness criterion including witting detailed acceptance criteria and defining and documenting exception processes.

experience of supporting and working closely with development teams and assisting testers in developing test scenarios and test automation using bdd/tdd or similar industry standard approach.

experience running workshops / requirements gathering events.

experience with atlassian tools including jira / confluence.

the data analyst will be responsible for supporting the national ebtech team in the accurate and timely movement of data between customer payroll/hcm and benefits administration software systems. most of ebtech customers need to keep data synchronous between the benefits administration software we deploy and support and the payroll/hcm software that the customer also utilizes. the successful completion of assigned tasks ensures that our customer’s employees receive access to or are removed from insurance coverage in a timely manner. in addition chosen benefits often include payroll deductions for employees so deductions calculated in benefits administration must be accurately reflected in payroll for proper processing. this is critical for ebtech’s ongoing success. as a data analyst you are responsible for ensuring that tasks are completed on-time with high quality and timeliness. the data analyst will work closely with the software integration team and other team members in overseeing the completion of all assigned tasks.

upload payroll demographic data files into benefits administration software platforms to keep data in sync between systems. analyze data errors/issues and complete corrections/updates in timely manner.format import and audit demographic and benefits enrollment data for new customer implementations of benefits administration software.review payroll deduction files including formatting and transmitting files post open enrollment to update customer payroll deductions.assist with deduction file setup including data entry and testing scenarios to ensure data is correct and ready for transmission.assist in payroll demographic data mapping – initial builds or updates as needed.provide support and answer questions from clients account managers payroll vendors and internal employees regarding payroll feeds for both demographic and deduction files. learn applicable software tools.track edi feed status sent/received and error report receipt from carriers on a weekly basis.follow organizational and line of business processes protocols and quality standards in the development and deployment of solutions.represent ebtech in a professional manner in every interaction with outside parties.provide continuous feedback on implementation status for both new sites and renewals with regard to above stated tasks.ensure timely and accurate completion of all assigned tasks.

at hiring company we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better internet. today the company runs one of the worlds largest networks that powers approximately 25 million internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to smbs to fortune 500 companies. hiring company protects and accelerates any internet application online without adding hardware installing software or changing a line of code. internet properties powered by hiring company all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network which gets smarter with every request. as a result they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. hiring company was named to entrepreneur magazines top company cultures list and ranked among the worlds most innovative companies by fast company.

build an amazing career with system pavers!

job description

system pavers is growing at a tremendous rate and we’re looking to expand our growing team with a data analyst. in this position you’ll be responsible for driving actionable insights from data that will support incredible growth for our organization in both the short and long term.

by working with system pavers you’ll be provided with the opportunity to be a part of making a direct impact on the business. if you’re focused on building the foundation for your success with a gratifying career that rewards your hard work drive and people skills you’ll fit right in.

about us

as the nation’s leading outdoor remodeling company system pavers has been creating gorgeous personalized living spaces that deliver quality beauty and durability we proudly stand behind. since opening in 1992 more than 85000 homeowners have trusted us to transform their outdoor lifestyles through remodels that add lasting value to their homes. as an established company with a reputation for stellar work we’re looking forward to many more years of meeting and exceeding customer expectations as leaders in our industry.

we invite you to experience and become a part of our amazing culture as we help one another pave the way to personal and professional success. join our energetic and positive team as we help guide homeowners through a rewarding outdoor remodeling journey.

find out more about us by visiting our website or visiting our careers page here .

we are growing and looking for a data analyst to join our team. as a data analyst at quest analytics you will provide analytical support to the product team in solving hard problems – customer problems and business problems – in ways that our customers love yet work for our business. there are two primary areas of focus. the first is analysis to support the quest accuracy solution – new product development product extensions and on-going maintenance. the second is analysis to support the development of data management and governance rules that can be applied to create a high quality high integrity master data set that acts as the foundation of all quest products.

the ideal candidate will have the technical skills to access and manage the data the analytical skills to draw insights that directly address business and client problems and needs and the communication skills to share those insights with both business and technical audiences.

while we empower our teams to figure out the best solutions to the problems that need to be solved we also hold those teams accountable to the results. we look for data analysts that are not afraid of signing up for business outcomes.

in this role you will
run analysis on healthcare provider and organization to determine various data pointsperform analysis that informs new products and product enhancementsanalyze new data sources and creating proposals for how they can be leveraged to solve client problemsinterpret results of analysis and communicate findings back to teammates in a clear mannerprovide actionable recommendations for improving data quality or integritywork with development and operations teams on solving business and data problemscollaborate with client service to understand and address client concerns around data or deliverablesperform in-depth data investigations related to client or provider questionsperform analysis to identify target populations for outreach campaignsanalyze data to demonstrate success overall by cohort by client and in demographic slices

bachelor’s degree; preferably in data analytics or computer engineeringa minimum of 3 to 5 years’ experience in a data analytics positionexperience working with large datasetsexperience with data tools such as databricks and sparkintermediate to advanced sql skillsfamiliarity with best practices of data management and governanceability to work independently and as part of a teamstrong communication skillsexperience with bi tools such as lookerexcellent troubleshooting listening and problem-solving skillsable to work in a fast-paced customer-focused and deadline-oriented environmentexperience with python r scala or java preferredexperience working with healthcare data preferred

 your opportunity 

as a data analyst in the finance data analytics department you will be responsible for maintaining improving and building new reporting capabilities for cross-functional areas of the business. by developing a deep understanding of operational processes and needs you will be responsible for implementing new reporting capabilities and using technology to deliver impactful reports. you will partner with teams in various functional areas of the business to implement process improvements that will streamline the efficiency and accuracy of the reporting process. you will be responsible to delivering daily weekly and monthly reports accurately and on time. you will also be involved in ad hoc analysis of large datasets to quickly provide insight into the business.

 functional support area: procurement/accounts payable/accounts receivable/support services 

core responsibilities
 function as an analytics and reporting expert for assigned functions by executing standard reports and running / maintaining ad hoc queries.  participate in the development of reports metrics models scorecards and dashboards by gathering data and transforming it into stories and insights that drive business recommendations and decision-making.  publish daily weekly and monthly reports accurately and on time  build reports and dashboards in microsoft power bi analysis for office bex and other reporting tools  participate in hosted training sessions on how to use the various tools and reports created by the department  generate load files for various systems maintaining system accuracy  communicate effectively with report stakeholders to ensure strong understanding of the methodology behind all calculations  perform ad hoc analysis using data from various systems and explain results of analysis to all levels of management  create sops and maintain documentation for processes  demonstrate continuous efforts to improve processes increase data integrity and provide quality customer service to our business partners.  provide comprehensive analytical and fact-based reporting to support and/or identify opportunities to impact operational results make changes to processes and support strategic initiatives. 
the above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. they are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities duties and skills required of personnel so classified. may perform other duties as assigned.

qualifications

to perform this job successfully an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. the requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge skill and/or ability required. reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions .
 bachelors degree from a regionally accredited four-year college or university in accounting/finance computer science/data analytics or related field and 2+ years of relevant work experience or equivalent combination of education and/or experience required.  ability to build models using advanced features of excel.  experience with power bi / tableau power pivot sap sap analysis for office bpc bex query designer.  experience in analyzing data within relational database systems such as ms access ms sql server and mysql.  experience with etl tools such as alteryx paxata dataguru or equivalent technologies preferred.  understanding of windows environment command line tools .bat files and task scheduler preferred.  experience with html/css/javascript and a backend technology like python-flask preferred.  experience with data analysis in python using pandas/numpy/jupyter notebooks preferred.  ability to quickly learn new technology and business logic.  superior analytical and problem-solving skills with superb attention to detail.  strong written and verbal communication skills.  ability to work independently in a fast-paced and rapidly changing and ambiguous environment.  ability to work well with others in fast paced dynamic environment.  ability to be respectful approachable and team oriented while building strong working relationships and a positive work environment.  up to 10% travel required.

about opensesame

opensesame helps develop the worlds most productive and admired workforces. with the most comprehensive catalog of elearning courses from the worlds top publishers we are here to help you every step of the way from finding courses mapping them to your core competencies syncing them with your lms to increasing utilization and improving your l&d programs. not only will you have the flexibility of multiple purchasing options from opensesame but youll also find it simple to use and administer your e-learning courses. to learn more visit www.opensesame.com/about.

about the team

the business intelligence bi team a small group of operations data analysis and data engineering professionals that oversee all aspects of opensesames critical business data. bi is first and foremost an internal support organization so meeting the needs of our users and stakeholders is our top priority. at the same time each bi team member is empowered to implement creative best-practice solutions that expand their level of subject matter expertise.

about the job

as a data analyst you will work as part of core part of the business intelligence bi team to work with internal stakeholders from various departments to satisfy their analytics and reporting needs. some departments have their own analysts and well defined reporting requirements where the role of the bi team is to empower them with the analytics tools they need such as exposing new dimensions and measures for their use. other departments require assistance to create reports dashboards and data-driven workflows to help their team operate smoothly. data analysts help all of these audiences to understand and use opensesames data to make informed decisions.
use our ticketing system to work with a broad range of internal requesters to create reports dashboards and data-driven workflows like alerts.write lookml and dbt code to create data models that use opensesames business logic to expose rich data sets to our internal customers.collaborate with the rest of the bi team to make our documentation better our training more effective and our team processes more scalable.

performance objectives 

as a data analyst you will assist internal looker stakeholders from the sales operations sales and customer success marketing support curation partners and accounting teams with business intelligence change requests and reporting and analysis enhancements. over time you will become a trusted partner with stakeholders and help guide key business process decisions.
within 30 days you will understand the core of opensesames business operations and data architecture and become familiar with our analytics tools and team processes.within 60 days you will start to help internal customers build reports and dashboards.within 120 days you will help refine our team processes to be more effective and productive.within 6 months you will help our team train others at opensesame to make more effective use of our data platform and self-serve answers to their analytics questions.

become the best version of yourself

we want opensesame to reflect the diversity of the communities we serve and the world we live in. we know that a variety of perspectives and voices strengthen our ability to deliver the spark of learning to everyone. we hold ourselves accountable to create more diverse equitable and inclusive communities through continuous learning personal growth and working to support our customers. we welcome you to bring your authentic self to our team and grow beyond your expectations.

at league we’re big on building connections - both through our product and with each other. our platform is consumer centric personalized and always on. we’re reimagining the health benefits experience to give people a more consumer-centric way to manage their health: immediate seamless and tailored to their unique needs. it’s a front door to healthcare that empowers people to live healthier happier lives. every day.

as a data analyst you will help us create an engaging product that improves the health outcomes of our users. in this role you will use in-depth analysis and governance of business intelligence to enable and drive our product managers and marketing team to improve the user experience and engagement on our platform.

people who have worked within cross-functional and multi-disciplined teams and enjoyed doing so will thrive in this role. furthermore you have experience in tying numbers to a larger more strategic business context. you enjoy communicating with non-technical stakeholders using the art of converting simple questions into complex analysis and translating them back into meaningful and actionable insights.

our data team also manages an internal business intelligence product that primarily leverages a sql-based etl to surface key performance indicators company-wide within looker. you will be working closely with data engineers and data scientists on the team to build and maintain our data pipelines to ingest and transform data from a variety of sources to support these bi tools.

in this role you will
 develop analytics strategies and frameworks to monitor and analyze product performance and business kpis related to application usage and user engagement & conversion.  provide insights through analysis to help inform decisions in all parts of the business including product management marketing and healthcare.  work closely with internal stakeholders to define the work you take on in support of their teams as well as communicate data considerations and issues they need to consider in their work.  work closely with data-engineers and data-scientists on data requirements reporting and forecasting of metrics.  regularly conduct tagging audits and analysis to ensure the accuracy of reports in particular of the client events generated by user button clicks and screen loads within the app. 
attributes
 you care deeply about using information and data in decision-making and have experience in communicating that logic to stakeholders.  you are a strong problem solver and can communicate the challenges and solutions effectively  you are a strong communicator and comfortable collaborating with groups and at times training or educating teams to use data tools or to understand results  you drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.  you like working in a fast-paced environment and are comfortable managing multiple tasks to tight deadlines.  you are eager to learn from others and help others grow with you. 
desired outcome
 ownership of stakeholder relationship where your consistent and impactful analysis and business intelligence work is aligned with company objectives.  empower your stakeholders to make data driven decisions by guiding and assisting them to use our data products and by providing them with data insights. 
required education/experience/certificates
 strong sql skills and experience working with a modern etl framework  experience working as a data analyst or data scientist  undergraduate or masters degree in business administration statistics computer science or similarly quantitative discipline or equivalent practical experience 
nice to have experience
data analysis and data manipulation in python pandas pyspark etchealthcare industry experience

job_title: online data analyst spanish us role
job_description_lines:
telus international ai-data solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their ai and machine learning models. the work of our ai community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. our ai community works in our proprietary ai training platform handling all data types text images audio video and geo across 500+ languages and dialects. we offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. the jobs are part-time and there is no fixed schedule. whoever you are wherever you come from come join our global ai community. www.telusinternational.com
 we are hiring freelance english & spanish speaking online data analyst’s for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps which are used by millions of users globally. the job would suit someone who is detail-oriented likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography. 
 this is a freelance position on a flexible schedule of up to 20 hours per week - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. you will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment eg verifying and comparing data determining the relevance and accuracy of information. you will be provided with guidelines for each task which need to be followed. the project offers a variety of tasks and work is paid per task. 

requirementsfull professional proficiency in english & spanishyou must be living in the united states of america the last 2 consecutive yearsability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines online maps and website informationyou must have familiarity with current and historical business media sport news social media and cultural affairs in the united states of americabeing open to work across a diverse set of task types e.g. maps news audio tasks relevanceapplicants must be 18 years or over. id verification must be attached when submitting your application. 
working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process including passing an open book assessment. this is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks. 

why join the telus international ai community? earn extra incomeaccess to our community wellbeing initiative remote work & location independencebe your own bossflexible hours to fit in with your lifestyle be a part of an online community

if you have any queries please feel free to contact us at sourcingteam19@telusinternational.ai

about hashicorp

at hashicorp we’re building a generation-defining infrastructure software company powered by our core principles and a growing team of talented committed professionals working together to help organizations seamlessly transition to and operate in the cloud. founded in 2012 and headquartered in san francisco 85 percent of our employees work remotely strategically distributed around the globe. from our inception we built the company with a remote-first approach because we believe talent has no boundaries.

about the role...

we have an exciting opportunity to join the it - data engineering team. reporting to the sr. manager data engineering this is a unique opportunity to design and develop a robust data architecture capable of fueling hashicorp’s future data analytics teams.

you will join a development team that is responsible for building deploying and supporting key components of a system of record the enterprise data warehouse. including automation of key business processes ensuring accuracy audit controls and completeness of data for company wide operational reporting and analysis.

successful candidates will have extensive experience working in data environments that support gtm fp&a customer support and related organizations with a passion for optimizing data environments that drive insight and innovation.

in this role you can expect to
deliver simple secure scalable and trusted data/business intelligence solutions and services to support teams across hashicorplead the delivery implementation and business adoption of scalable and reliable data warehouse business intelligence and data analytics solutions for cross-department leadership and business teamsanticipate issues manage dependencies and drive solutions manage and build infrastructure required for optimal etl of data from a wide variety of data sources translate data and analytic results into strategic insights for leadership and business stakeholdersensure successful completion of projects across the software development life-cycle partnering with business stakeholders make business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative informationenvision develop and deploy analytics solutions to streamline processes that will lead to efficiency gains and improvement of key metricsbecome a subject matter expert for all things analytics within the data engineering organization
you may be a good fit if you have
3+ years with relevant data analyst business analyst and/or data warehousing experience2+ hands-on it data management experiencepassionate about understanding data and its relevance to business decisionsability to operate in a fast-moving environment supporting a rapidly growing businessexperience building and operating mission critical data warehouses marts and lakesexperience with complex initiatives and goalsworking in teams that are mission criticaldemonstrated self starter skills taking initiative when the opportunity presents itself
hashicorp embraces diversity and equal opportunity. we are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds perspectives and skills. we believe the more inclusive we are the better our company will be.

for more information regarding how hashicorp collects uses and manages personal information please review our privacy policy.

at academic partnerships we drive change through innovation in online education using the strengths experience and creativity of our people. as a leader in online program management we are focused on facilitating the goal of scalable online program success for our university partners and the students they serve—from the dream of a degree to a bold reality. our company is built on the foundation of our mission - to expand access to top-quality affordable and workforce relevant degree programs that serve career pathways. come join a company that helps make dreams into reality!

the data analyst will report into the director of data analytics and is responsible for regularly analyzing our university partners’ performance and providing insights and root cause analysis to the business and helping them to continuously identify areas of improvement. he/she will utilize their superior visualization and analytical abilities to help our stakeholders to better forecast demand track performance and assess the impact of operational changes on the business. they will assist in the development of predictive models that help the business to better understand the primary drivers of performance. they will work closely with our stakeholders to understand their business questions translate those questions into an analytical strategy and execute that strategy in order to provide the needed insights to move the business forward.

responsibilities include
develop and maintain tableau dashboards to help our stakeholders track the trends of key performance indicators. field ad hoc data analytic requests and provide the business with data and insights to answer their immediate business questions.create and maintain excel based reports to regularly track business performance.assist in wrangling/transforming data needed to build predictive models.assist in building and operationalizing supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms.work closely with the information technology team on all mdm and data governance improvement initiatives where analytic support is needed.work closely with the performance analyst team and functional stakeholders to regularly identify areas for improvement and potential opportunities from observed data trends. test the impact of operational and marketing changes and perform roi analyses to quantify the value of these improvements.own the enrollment forecasting process and build/maintain a model to better predict new weekly enrollments.at the direction of the business analytics leadership work collaboratively with other stakeholders to provide the business with analysis on insights into areas of opportunity across the organization.
qualifications include
bachelor’s degree in data analytics or a related field. at least 2 years of corporate experience managing manipulating visualizing modeling and creating insights from data.expert using sql to collect clean and join data from disparate traditional and cloud-based databases and performing descriptive/diagnostic analytics on resulting datasets to create insights for business stakeholders. experience with a/b testing methodologies.experience building predictive models in python or r.expert creating world class visualizations using tableau and/or power bi to help business stakeholders easily identify performance trends and diagnose areas for improvement. experience in building maintaining and continuously improving operational or demand forecasting models preferred. highly proficient with excel formulas and macros word and powerpoint.solid understanding of relational database structure and data management principles.experience with google analytics and big query preferred.solid understanding of sales funnels and experience analyzing crm data preferredstrong problem solving quantitative and analytical abilities.strong ability to plan and manage numerous processes and projects simultaneously.proven effective communication collaboration and presentation skills.ability to effectively communicate difficult messages while being able to maintain strong relationships. seen as a trusted advisor to functional leaders across the business.

pto – accumulated from day one11 designated holidaysmedical – four options including ppo and hdpdentalvisionlife & disability company paidflexible spending account & health savings account company contribution to hsaretirement plan with company matchmaternity / paternity / parental leave company paidvolunteer time off

you’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the u.s. as you take on some tough challenges.

energize your career with one of healthcare’s fastest growing companies.

you dream of a great career with a great company – where you can make an impact and help people. we dream of giving you the opportunity to do just this. and with the incredible growth of our business it’s a dream that definitely can come true. already one of the world’s leading healthcare companies unitedhealth group is restlessly pursuing new ways to operate our service centers improve our service levels and help people lead healthier lives. we live for the opportunity to make a difference and right now we are living it up.

this opportunity is with one of our most exciting business areas: optum – a growing part of our family of companies that make unitedhealth group a fortune 10 leader.

optum helps nearly 60 million americans live their lives to the fullest by educating them about their symptoms conditions and treatments; helping them to navigate the system finance their healthcare needs and stay on track with their health goals. no other business touches so many lives in such a positive way. and we do it all with every action focused on our shared values of integrity compassion relationships innovation & performance.

we offer paid training. the hours during training will be 9:00am to 6:00pm cst monday to friday. rotating saturdays. training will be conducted virtually from your home.

this position is full-time 40 hours/week monday to friday. it may be necessary given the business need to work occasional overtime or weekends.
all telecommuters will be required to adhere to unitedhealth group’s telecommuter policy.

primary responsibilities:

maintain a successful working relationship between lhi and network providers through working with many varied clinical delivery systems. being able to understand and identify the best alignment of appointment requirements to clinical times available within the varied clinical delivery systems. communicate with internal customers to ensure the most efficient use of time to accomplish department goals and contract requirements. assess and resolve scheduling concerns developing and implementing solutions in many varied clinical delivery systems. manage urgent scheduling needs and frequently shift priorities in order to maximize resources and capabilities to effectively support customer needs. negotiate days and times that align provider needs lhi business objectives and veteran’s availability. review qualified providers in the current provider network. manually assign and schedule appointments while analyzing cost and scheduling timeliness to meet contractual expectations. continually communicate with veteran services provider network management and other departments to accomplish mission tasks related to scheduling procedures. maintain constant awareness of queue status in order satisfy internal queue calls related to veteran reschedules urgent provider updates and miscellaneous order issues.

you’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

associates degree or higher business marketing and communications or healthcare related field or equivalent experience or experience and/or applicable military experience bachelor’s degree or higher in business marketing and communications or healthcare related field 1+ years related experience provider relations network management customer service medical dental or healthcare insurance experience national career readiness certificate medical or dental knowledge database experience/education knowledge of veteran’s compensation and claims process

careers with optum. heres the idea. we built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. so when it comes to how we use the worlds large accumulation of health - related information or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. optum part of the unitedhealth group family of businesses brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. for you that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. optum incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your lifes best work.sm
